name: Hilton New York Fashion District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was OK except the A/C unit. It was old unit and loud. Front desk agents were not service oriented, typical NYC hotel standard? We did not like the surroundings of the hotel - dirty. We probably will not go back.
reviews.title: Decent hotel if you can book under $200

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cannot beat this hotel for the location, price, cleanliness and great bar restaurant to boot! We booked our room for $220/night which was a very fair price. Our room was clean (the most important factor for me), spacious, great bath products & very quiet. I asked for a quiet room b/c I have insomnia so our room was in back of hotel so not much of a view but that was fine with me.
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.text: This location is perfect b/c if you want to walk uptown or downtown, it's an easy walk with lots to see on the way. I only hope that I can stay here again and get the same price!
reviews.title: Decent hotel, ok location

reviews.text: Stayed here in Oct 2012, two nights. Small room, but decently located on the 15th floor which gives you an ok view on the Empire State Building. Loved the shower, which was perfect. Nicely sorted minibar, prices not so nicely. WIFI is expensive ($15 per day), unless your Elite Hilton member. Hotel has a great roofterrace and bar, great views over the city.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.text: The area itself is a bit gritty in my opinion, but is a decent base to explore the city. Macy's is a few blocks away (8 to be prices), the High Line is nearby, and the Meat Packing Disctrict is 10 blocks south.
reviews.title: Ideal choice for break in NYC

reviews.text: I spent here only one night but was positively impressed. I booked through the hilton website and the site gave me 199 USD for a guestroom. When I arrived the lobby and the rooms looked very modern and classy. Room was not big, but that can be expected in NYC but it was very well done. Nice view of the empire state building and surrounding areas. The hallways get a bit noisy sometimes when people are waiting for the elevators though. For the rest a good choice in NYC.
reviews.title: excellent location in midtown. good prices

reviews.text: I must say that the valet parking of 55 US was very expensive, but I did not have any other idea where to park the car, so I did it.
reviews.title: OK Base

reviews.text: I stayed here while visiting NYC with work. Overall, not a bad place. The rooms are fine, if a bit smaller than a lot of other Hiltons I've stayed in. Bed was comfy and the noise from the street was not too bad (I was on the 9th floor).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.text: Reception staff were freindly and helpful, so no problems there.
reviews.title: Fashion can be comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was free, but I only had it once as they took so long to deliver the food I didn't really have time to eat it, and they forgot one of the items I ordered!
reviews.title: A cozy, boutique Hilton

reviews.text: It is quite hard to find a reasonably priced hotel in NYC. I tried this Hilton after having mediocre experiences at several other "mid-priced" alternatives.
reviews.title: fashionable lobby and that's about it.

reviews.text: The location is OK but it is neither in mid-twon or Soho. It is in between most of the things you want to see as a tourist.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is sort of fashionable in a way that will last at most five years. The rest of the hotel has nothing that could be remotely called fashionable.
reviews.title: Small hotel, good service in a good location, we would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof top bar is packed and requires you to pass by a bouncer in the lobby. It must be thought to be very good but is hard to see why. i ordered food and gave up after 30 minutes. There was no where to sit within fifteen minutes of its opening.
reviews.title: Confortable, clean, and excellent staff

reviews.text: This place is new to me, I decided to stay there because it is pretty close to my office. I was pleasantly surprised at how hip, yet nice the place was. They were very busy because of the NY fashion week.
reviews.title: great hotel for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good Location at this hotel. Very trendy for it being a Hilton, looks more like a small W hotel or a morgans group hotel. Rooms were very small, very similar to the W on lexington if you have stayed there.
reviews.title: Not bad, definitely could do better at that price

reviews.text: I was only there for a night, good check in, no upgrade or anything (Diamond Member). I wasnt even told that there was no upgrade available or something. After check in went to get some food and the elevators weren't working. Had to go down the stairs and never got an apology or even a notice to my rooms that the elevators were back and working. The weird thing is that they lock 1 of the elevators to take people to the lounge on the roof. And even though the other elevators werent working they didn't even try to accomodate the guests of the hotel.
reviews.title: They tried!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didnt try breakfast or the hotel restaurant. They bellmen did a good job of getting me a cab to the airport, kudos to them!
reviews.title: Great Base for discovering New York

reviews.text: It was an ok experience, would definitely look for other hotel when in NYC, rate was 379 so i am sure I can find something nicer for that price even in NYC.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Good air conditioning! and nice bed!!
reviews.title: We were so lucky to be at this Hilton during Sandy

reviews.text: The new Hilton in the Fashion district is a great location. Trendy, hip, small room - very "W Hotel" feel to it. It does not feel like a normal Hilton. The staff was friendly & the room service came SUPER fast (less than 20 minutes). The downside for me was I had a low level room (2nd floor) so I was kept awake all night long by street noise, car honks, etc. The rooms are very small but that's quite normal for Manhattan. The walls in this hotel are very thin so I heard every toilet flush, TV program and conversation of the rooms around me which is quite annoying when you're there for work and just need some sleep.
reviews.title: Trendy, New, Boutique hotel

reviews.text: Clean hotel, very friendly staff. But I couldn't sleep because there is no insulation in the walls at all. It was really loud outside the whole night. Also, I could hear every phone conversation the guy in the next room had even though my bed was on the opposite wall. And the people in the other room sure flushed their toilet a lot.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife booked us a room at the Hilton Fashion District during our recent trip to New York. I don't recall how much we paid for 3 nights, but I recall it being a phenomenal price for New York City.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Hilton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service here was great. Upon check-in, we were provided 2 bottles of water and some candy. In fact, anytime we asked for more bottled water, the front desk gladly provided it. Our room was also a great size (for NY standards). The room was clean and updated. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was updated. Everything about our room was very tastefully decorated, which we appreciated.
reviews.title: Convenient and serviceable, but reservation hassles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rather than going on and on about our room, all I can say is that we had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Hilton. Also, the hotel has a restaurant/bar in the lobby (which we did not get to try) as well as a bar on the roof. We did visit the top-level bar every night that we were there. Drinks were not outrageously expensive and it was never too packed for us to enjoy a drink or two.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: This was the 1st (and NOT the last), time we had stayed in this particular hotel in NYC. By NY standards the rooms are quite roomy. Very clean, nice amenities, comfy beds, plenty of storage space and lots of electric outlets!! Bathroom was not huge, but generously sized. The staff could not have been more courteous and helpful. Many less expensive places to eat or just grab a coffee very near by (Dunkin Donuts, Whole Foods, Chipotle Grill). The location of this hotel makes it perfect for many activities in the city. Since it is not quite mid-town is is a little quieter and less hustle & bustle. The bell staff will gladly get you a cab.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in NYC!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we were checking out and telling the gals @ the desk how much we enjoyed our stay, she handed us 2 "goodie bags", containing water, pretzels and jelly beans! I've NEVER had that happen before! Lovely touch!!!!!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for 3 nights recently & were pleasantly surprised. We had a king room & it was bigger than most in NYC but still small. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. The bed was very comfy & it had a great shower. The staff was nice & the rooftop bar was very nice. I would stay here again. The hotel was close enough to everything & very clean.
reviews.title: A Gem in NYC

reviews.text: The Hilton New York Fashion District is truly a great place to stay.Oversized rooms that are clean and comfortable;stylish throughout the hotel;plenty of reasonably priced restaurants;a pleasant staff and great amenities(shower,gym,bar) makes this one of the best places to stay in NYC.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: So this will be my second review about the Hilton. Stayed there with my dad for a short holiday in New York.
reviews.title: Very Cool, excellent service

reviews.text: This is my new favorite hotel in NYC. I've already booked my next 3 stays (I am in NYC every other week for work). It is convenient to the 1 train, has some of the largest, cleanest rooms I have seen in Manhattan, and a shower that rivals my Kohler shower at home. The gym is nice and the hotel overall feels very new and safe. I enjoy the fact I get an e-mail before and after every stay confirming I get and did get everything I wanted. The burger bar in the hotel is also convenient and is the first time I've eaten in a hotel in a long time.
reviews.title: Great Stay! Great Location! I will be coming back...

reviews.text: Ahram Suh the Guest Services Manager at the Hilton Fashion District consistently reaches out to ensure I have everything I need for my upcoming stay. A high point of my last trip is the door man walking two blocks down the street to get me a cab at 6am. He made it clear, no tip necessary!
reviews.title: Nice place for the most part

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived early ( before the 3:00 checkin time) and they had our room ready, which was nice. The first night was very quiet - had a room facing W. 26th. The second night, which was a Friday, the street level got very loud around 1 or 2 in the morning. The third night was not as bad but early in the morning someone slammed a door on our floor. The room itself was good. One strange thing was that there were no towel racks - only one on the shower door. I like to hang up the hand towel and not have it on the wet bath towels. There was non ice bucket or place to get ice. Had to call the front desk. My husband needed to ice his arm and had to wait a 1/2 hour for them to bring ice. Staff was nice - computer printer not working - so they printed my boarding passes at the front desk. I thought the location was good. Walk a few blocks up on 7th and there are all kinds of breakfast and lunch places. We walked to the theatre district/ Times Square. There are 2 subway stops for the 1 train within 2 or 3 blocks either direction. Beautiful day on our last day and we walked back to hotel from West Village area. Easy to get to most places from this location.
reviews.title: Great Rooftop
Wonderful helpful service
reviews.text: Great hotel. The location is fantastic as you are between the lower west side and mid-town not to mention all the stuff you can find in Chelsea. Also, you can walk everywhere and if you get tired the hotel is close to the subway. Having said that one of the best features is the rooftop patio. You can relax with a drink and enjoy the views of the city.

I arrived at this hotel to find that agora had stuffed up my booking. Despite Agoda sending sending me a voucher the hotel didn't have any record of a booking. The wonderful front desk staff went out of their way to help us contact Agoda and try to sort it out. All Agoda could offer was to organise to book us into another hotel (after 5 hours o n the road this was not what we wanted). Despite being booked out the hotel managed to make a room available for us and even brought up a bottle of champagne to our room after we had checked in.
reviews.title: Amazing NYC Hilton

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel on business for 3 nights. After a long day of meetings on my 3rd day, I sat down at the bar "Rare" which I have been told has separate ownership. The bartender had very glassy eyes, a runny nose and was sneezing, coughing and talking very loudly about how loopy the medicine she was on was making her feel. This was the person serving drinks and food! I had already been at the bar for a while when I realized how bad off she was. I immediately left without being able to eat my dinner. I called the front desk to inform them. They told me she would be sent home (I didn't even have to describe her, it was obvious who it was). I flew out to Whistler to ski the next day and of course came down with the same symptoms the bartender complained of (and lost my voice just as she was). I realize there is no guarantee that it came from her, but it ruined my ski vacation. I e-mailed Hilton to let them know what occurred. the logic was that given the horrible germ season, the hotel could remind the employees not to come to work sick. I got an e-mail back from "Wanda" that said the hotel would contact me within 3 days. They never did and Wanda hasn't responded to my follow-up email. This tells me the hotel does not take health safety complaints seriously.
reviews.title: Unsanitary Conditions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've traveled around the world enough to know you pay for what you get. I've learned recently that you don't have to put a dent in your pocket to get great quality service. Too bad it took several overnight stays in New York for me to find the perfect hotel. Again, I will be honest with you when I will tell you that I truly believe you pay for what you get...but after booking rooms that have range from $350.00 to $425.00 a night I was a bit hesitant when I found the HIlton New York Fashion District and only paying $137.00 a night. I read the reviews and questioned myself over and over again. Then finally I booked it with the hotel directly. Chelsea, who helped book the reservations was friendly and had a great personality. I checked in this past Sunday to be greeted by professional staff members. Although my room was not ready at time of arrival I understood it was only 11am and may have to wait until 3pm to do so. They stored my luggage and off I went to hit the town. The location is perfect for those who want to do Uptown or Downtown. It's close to the subway and a skip and a hop from 34th Street. Finally, I received the call around 3pm that my room was ready...Whaalla! I opened the door to room 211 and was very suprised. Not only was the room equipped with a MP3 player, Keurig, large flat screen mounted on the wall but also had all the ammeneties that you would need to make your overnight stay comfortable. Overall, if you are looking for a great, clean hotel that is going to leave your pocket full then choose this Hilton property where you will find the staff pleasant but also very eager to help you in any way. This will be the one any only hotel I will stay at for furture trips to NYC.
reviews.title: A GREAT STAY AT HALF THE COST

reviews.text: I had a three week stay at this hotel post Hurricane Sandy and into the beginning of the holiday season. Just as reference, I stayed at two other NYC hotels within the following month, neither of which could hold a candle to this place.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text: This is a fairly small hotel by New York standards and had a boutique feel to it. The lobby is fairly small but hip, fashionable and sophisticated. Front desk staff was extremely accommodating, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: almost perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location. Away from, but within reasonable distance to, the theater district and touristy and bustling Times Square. Quieter and less congested. Food is less expensive than it is 12 blocks north and tons of non-touristy dining options. Starbucks around the corner. One block to the subway. Whole Foods a block and a half away. Greenwich Village and SoHo close enough to walk.
reviews.title: Fashionably Comfortable in NYC

aka: Hilton New York Fashion District Hotel New York City
description: Be fashionable. One of New York City's newest hotels, Hilton New York Fashion District offers stunning design, exemplary service and four-star amenities in the heart of the fashion capital of the world. Located on West 26th Street in one of Manhattan's most remarkable neighborhoods, Hilton New York Fashion District is steps away from the Fashion Institute of Technology, The Empire State Building, Herald Square and the renowned Macy's flagship.
